remarks: A join's second argument is less than or equal to the join.  Special case of ~ latlej2 to show an atom is on a line.  (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2013.)
statement:
hlatlej.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
hlatlej.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
hlatlej.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
hlatlej2 $p |- ( ( K e. HL /\ P e. A /\ Q e. A ) -> Q .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) $.
